summary: The Child Care Workforce and Facilities Act of 2025 aims to increase access to quality child care by providing grants to states and tribal entities. These grants will fund projects focused on expanding the child care workforce through training and credentialing, and for the construction, expansion, or renovation of child care facilities, particularly in child care deserts. The bill defines key terms, outlines application requirements, specifies the federal share (50%), and mandates an evaluation and report to Congress. It authorizes appropriations of $100 million for fiscal years 2025-2031.
